forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 78. Heat index values as high as 99. West wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Rain Showers then Chance Showers And Thunderstorms
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers between 9am and 2pm, then a chance of showers and thunderstorms between 2pm and 5pm, then a chance of showers and thunderstorms. Mostly sunny. High near 92, with temperatures falling to around 86 in the afternoon. North wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

weather_report:
As the sun retreats into its nightly slumber, Boston basks in the lingering warmth of a summer evening. The air, saturated with the day’s heat, holds a gentle whisper of a breeze, lightly rustling the leaves. With a temperature holding steady around 78 degrees, it feels notably sultry, the heat index nudging towards an almost stifling 99. Tonight, the sky remains unblemished by clouds, offering a canvas of deepening blues that presage a peaceful night ahead.

Looking towards tomorrow, the forecast hints at an unfolding drama in the form of rain showers and thunderstorms sprouting through the late morning and early afternoon. Yet, before the day fully unfurls, a brief interlude of pleasant sunshine will greet early risers, temperatures peaking near 92, then settling back to a cooler embrace as the afternoon continues. The promise of rain could dampen the high spirits of a summer’s day, so it might be wise to have an umbrella close at hand. Dress lightly but be prepared to adapt; breathable fabrics will serve you well under the sun’s gaze and the oppressive humidity that accompanies it. As you ponder how to spend your day, a leisurely stroll along the Charles River could bring blissful moments of reflection and peace, perhaps mingled with the first raindrops that whisper promises of relief.

#S0BAC0
